headline.main: Santorum Campaigns in Michigan's Upper Peninsula

docs.abstract: About 275 people came out on a snowy Sunday to see Rick Santorum, one of the few politicians to travel all the way up to Michigan's sparsely populated Upper Peninsula.
docs.snippet: About 275 people came out on a snowy Sunday to see Rick Santorum, one of the few politicians to travel all the way up to Michigan's sparsely populated Upper Peninsula.

docs.lead_paragraph: Rick Santorum brought the hateful rhetoric of the culture war to one of America’s last strongholds of bipartisan cooperation: care for people with disabilities.
docs.snippet: Rick Santorum brought the hateful rhetoric of the culture war to one of America’s last strongholds of bipartisan cooperation: care for people with disabilities.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican-led legislatures are putting off the creation of supermarkets for subsidized private coverage until they know if President Obama can enforce the law.

headline.seo: A Wait-and-See Approach for States on Insurance Exchanges
headline.main: Many States Take a Wait-and-See Approach on New Insurance Exchanges
headline.print_headline: Many States Take a Wait-and-See Approach on New Insurance Exchanges

docs.abstract: Republican-led legislatures in many states are putting off the creation of supermarkets for subsidized private coverage until they know if Pres Obama can enforce the law; are waiting for a Supreme Court decision or even the November election results, to see whether central elements of the new law might be overturned or repealed; a handful of states are moving at a brisk pace to establish insurance exchanges.
docs.snippet: Republican-led legislatures are putting off the creation of supermarkets for subsidized private coverage until they know if President Obama can enforce the law.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama was aloof to the proposals of a panel he created, but later adopted many of them in a modified form, a sign of his larger struggle with the politics of deficit reduction.

headline.seo: Obama’s Unacknowledged Debt to Bowles-Simpson Plan

docs.abstract: Pres Obama opted not to endorse proposals of the Simpson-Bowles commission, a panel he created, but later adopted many of them in a modified form, a sign of his larger struggle with the politics of deficit reduction; story of how Obama dealt with deficit commission shows how those struggles have curbed his ambitions and forced him to confront the limits of his persuasive powers (Series: A Measure of Change).
docs.snippet: President Obama was aloof to the proposals of a panel he created, but later adopted many of them in a modified form, a sign of his larger struggle with the politics of deficit reduction.

keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Former Senator Don Nickles of Oklahoma responds to a news article, “Conservatives Sowed Idea of Health Care Mandate, Only to Spurn It Later.”
docs.abstract: Letter from former Sen Don Nickles comments on the February 15 article on the evolution of the idea of a health insurance mandate.
docs.snippet: Former Senator Don Nickles of Oklahoma responds to a news article, “Conservatives Sowed Idea of Health Care Mandate, Only to Spurn It Later.”

headline.main: An Ad by Senator Brown Angers a Kennedy Son

docs.abstract: Patrick Kennedy says an ad by Senator Scott Brown is inaccurate, that his father, Edward M. Kennedy, would not have supported an amendment that would allow both employers and insurers to deny coverage for any service that they say violates their religious beliefs.

docs.abstract: Sometimes when you turn on the TV, it's hard not to wonder: Is humanity devolving?
docs.snippet: Sometimes when you turn on the TV, it's hard not to wonder: Is humanity devolving?

headline.main: Santorum Says Religion and Conservative Principles Are at Risk

docs.abstract: Two days before the Arizona and Michigan primaries, Rick Santorum argued that religion and conservative principles are at risk, saying President Obama is a “snob” for encouraging all Americans to go to college.
docs.snippet: Two days before the Arizona and Michigan primaries, Rick Santorum argued that religion and conservative principles are at risk, saying President Obama is a “snob” for encouraging all Americans to go to college.
